thread.title: Kremlin demands Fox News apology for O’Reilly's Putin comments
thread.title_full: Kremlin demands Fox News apology for O’Reilly's Putin comments

author: JASON SILVERSTEIN
title: Kremlin demands Fox News apology for O’Reilly's Putin comments
text:
Kremlin demands apology from Fox News for Bill O’Reilly calling Vladimir Putin a ‘killer’ Kremlin demands Fox News apology for O’Reilly's Putin comments  26 AM 
Bill O’Reilly hurt Vladimir Putin’s feelings. 
The Kremlin on Monday demanded an apology from Fox News for O’Reilly calling the Russian President a “killer” during a much-publicized interview with President Trump. 
“We believe that such a statement by the Fox News host was insulting and impermissible,” Russian presidential spokesman Dmitry Peskov told reporters. 
“We would prefer to hear apologies addressed to the president from such a respectable television network.” 
White House considering removing sanctions against Russia: Pence 
Fox News did not immediately respond to the request. 
O’Reilly took shots at Putin during an interview with Trump that aired ahead of the Super Bowl on Sunday. 
Trump — who has publicly championed the Russian strongman and American adversary for months — told O’Reilly he respects Putin and is willing to work with him on some causes, such as fighting ISIS. 
“Will I get along with them? I have no idea,” Trump said. 
“He’s a killer, though,” O’Reilly interjected. 
“Putin’s a killer.” 
Trump nodded and thought for a moment, then replied, “A lot of killers, we got a lot of killers. What, you think our country’s so innocent?” President Trump discussed Vladimir Putin with Bill O'Reilly in the much-publicized interview. (Fox News) 
The Kremlin made no comment about Trump's remarks. 
Russia has aided Syrian President Bashar Assad during Syria’s civil war, and a United Nations report last year said Russia had killed more than 2,704 civilians there — more than ISIS has. Putin has also been accused of ordering the deaths of journalists and political opponents in Russia. 
Trump has doggedly defended Putin against allegations of wrongdoing, including previous assertions that the Russian leader is a killer. 
In December 2015, MSNBC host Joe Scarborough told Trump that Putin “kills journalists that don’t agree with him.” 
“Well, I think that our country does plenty of killing too, Joe,” Trump replied. 
In another interview days later, Trump said he had heard that Putin kills people, but didn’t know whether to believe it. 
“I haven’t seen that,” Trump told ABC News. 
“I don’t know that he has. If he has killed reporters I think that’s terrible. But this isn’t like somebody that’s stood with a gun and he’s taken the blame or he’s admitted that he’s killed. He’s always denied it.” 
With News Wire Services
